Config.Name: SHARELATEX_APP_NAME
Config.Description: The name to display when talking about the running app. Defaults to 'Overleaf (Community Edition)'.

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_NAV_TITLE
Config.Description: Set the tab title of the application

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_SITE_URL
Config.Description: Where your instance of Overleaf is publicly available. This is used in public links, and when connecting over websockets, so must be configured correctly!

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_ADMIN_EMAIL
Config.Description: The email address where users can reach the person who runs the site.

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_REDIS_HOST
Config.Description: The host name of the Redis instance to use

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_REDIS_PORT
Config.Description: The port of the Redis instance to use

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_REDIS_PASS
Config.Description: The password to use when connecting to Redis (if applicable)

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_MONGO_URL
Config.Description: The URL of the Mongo database to use

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_BEHIND_PROXY
Config.Description: Set to true if running behind a proxy like nginx/apache allowing it to correctly detect the forwarded IP address

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_SESSION_SECRET
Config.Description: A random string which is used to secure tokens, if load balancing this needs to be set to the same toke across boxes. If only 1 instance is being run it does not need to be set by the user.

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_SECURE_COOKIE
Config.Description: Set this to something non-zero to use a secure cookie. Only use this if your Overleaf instance is running behind a reverse proxy with SSL configured.

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_RESTRICT_INVITES_TO_EXISTING_ACCOUNTS
Config.Description: If set to true, will restrict project invites to email addresses which correspond with existing user accounts.

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_ALLOW_PUBLIC_ACCESS
Config.Description: If set to 'true', will allow non-authenticated users to view the site. The default is false, which means non-authenticated users will be unconditionally redirected to the login page when they try to view any part of the site. Note, setting this option does not disable authentication or security in any way. This option is necessary if your users intend to make their projects public and have non-authenticated users view those projects.

Config.Name: SHARELATEX_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_READ_AND_WRITE_SHARING
Config.Description: If set to 'true', will allow anonymous users to view and edit projects shared via the new link-sharing feature.
